content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: The figure presents a single measure on a staff in Treble clef. There is no Key signature or Time signature. A homophonic chord of three whole notes is shown with pitches B flat 4, D 5 and F 5.
The figure presents a single measure on a staff in Treble clef. There is no Key signature or Time signature. A homophonic chord of three whole notes is shown with pitches B flat 4, D flat 5 and F 5.

The figure presents a single measure on a staff in Treble clef. There is no Key signature or Time signature. A homophonic chord of three whole notes is shown with pitches B flat 4, D flat 5 and F flat 5.
The figure presents a single measure on a staff in Treble clef. There is no Key signature or Time signature. A homophonic chord of three whole notes is shown with pitches B flat 4, D 5 and F sharp 5.

content.answer: The figure presents a single measure on a staff in Treble clef. There is no Key signature or Time signature. A homophonic chord of three whole notes is shown with pitches B flat 4, D 5 and F sharp 5.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

topic.text: 3.1: Triad and Chord Qualities (M, m, d, A)

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
